headline: Politico writes of those rural, Biden-supporting Democrats who are ‘suffering in silence’ in red states
author: Brett T.
sentences:
https://t.co/n7R6ZHRzeh
— POLITICO (@politico) March 5, 2022
Christopher Cadelago writes:
In the pandemic’s darkest days, a man living across the street from a Methodist church in this small town raised a flag in front of his house emblazoned with the words “Fuck Biden.”
…
“We’ve never seen this before,” says Joanne Fitzpatrick, a Democrat from DuBois, running through a tally in her head of anti-Biden signs that still cover her town and surrounding communities.

— BattleSwarm (@BattleSwarmBlog) March 4, 2022
“perils”
— JCF (@jcfris1) March 4, 2022
That reminds me…I need to get to Hobby Lobby to spell out "Let's Go Brandon" with craft letters and googly eyes…
— John Washam (@JohnWasham2) March 5, 2022
If I was the employee I would have said, “I’m sorry m’am we don’t have a designated safe space.”
— Julie Shera (@Bothered_Blonde) March 4, 2022
The subhead says rural Dems are suffering in silence.

“at a crafts store when she stumbled into an aisle display where someone had used big, block letters to spell out “T-R-U-M-P.” She flagged it for a store employee, who she says assured her it wasn’t constructed by anyone working there.” https://t.co/Dz5Xaval5C
— David Marcus (@BlueBoxDave) March 4, 2022
Let’s hope she doesn’t see the meme floating around of “Let’s Go Brandon” spelled out in big letters in a craft store.

We’ve just never seen this level of vulgarity after an election — and so long after the election at that.”
“In a civilized society,” she added, “we just don’t do that.”
Is she actually serious when she says we’ve never seen this level of vulgarity after an election?

Analysis: You’ve read the stories about Trump’s appeal in rural America, but there’s another side that’s often left out: Rural Democrats who feel abandoned by a party they fear has stopped fighting to win the places where they live.

A quick look at Twitter shows us that Democrats and supporters of President Joe Biden certainly aren’t silent — they still can’t shut up about Donald Trump or January 6 or even Sen. Ted Cruz flying to Cancun during a winter storm.

It wasn’t so long ago “The Daily Show,” which deleted a tweet poking fun at President Biden’s State of the Union speech, did a segment asking if profane anti-Biden signs should be allowed to be posted in public.

(@ErikaLP9) March 5, 2022
Notice the left always wants to “tattle” on someone to the nearest authority

The party of histrionic neurotic women; even the men.

Note: regardless of Ivy, NYU or Cal Berkeley pedigrees, if you are triggered by block letters spelling TRUMP, you are not above anyone…

That's pathetic.

— WestwardHo (@WestwardHo6) March 4, 2022
“For the better part of two decades now, the Republican Party has been formulating fear and really fear of others,” [Theron G. Noble] says.

It has just really made people into tribes.”
Try being conservative on a college campus and we'll talk
— ericontrarian (@eriContrarian) March 4, 2022
Preach.
Politico Magazine has a new feature out profiling those rural Democrats who are “suffering in silence” because they feel alone and abandoned by the party.
So we’re guessing this is real-life suffering in silence, when you’re the only person in the grocery store wearing a mask and just seething about it.

(@InezFeltscher) March 4, 2022
